supportsInterface(bytes4).details: Returns true if this contract implements the interface defined by `interfaceId`. See the corresponding EIP section https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-165#how-interfaces-are-identified to learn more about how these ids are created. This function call must use less than 30 000 gas.

simulate(address,bytes).details: Performs a delegatecall on a targetContract in the context of self. Internally reverts execution to avoid side effects (making it static). Catches revert and returns encoded result as bytes.Inspired by https://github.com/gnosis/util-contracts/blob/bb5fe5fb5df6d8400998094fb1b32a178a47c3a1/contracts/StorageAccessible.sol

params.calldataPayload: Calldata that should be sent to the target contract (encoded method name and arguments).

onERC1155Received(address,address,uint25.notice: Handles ERC1155 Token callback. return Standardized onERC1155Received return value.

onERC721Received(address,address,uint256.notice: Handles ERC721 Token callback.  return Standardized onERC721Received return value.

supportsInterface(bytes4).notice: Implements ERC165 interface support for ERC1155TokenReceiver, ERC721TokenReceiver and IERC165.

tokensReceived(address,address,address,u.notice: Handles ERC777 Token callback. return nothing (not standardized)

Make sure to carefully        audit the guard code and design recovery mechanisms.

params.guard: The address of the guard to be used or the 0 address to disable the guard

setGuard(address).notice: Set Transaction Guard `guard` for the Safe. Make sure you trust the guard.

devdoc.title: Module Manager - A contract managing Safe modules

disableModule(address,address).notice: Disables the module `module` for the Safe.

enableModule(address).notice: Enables the module `module` for the Safe.

execTransactionFromModule(address,uint25.notice: Execute `operation` (0: Call, 1: DelegateCall) to `to` with `value` (Native Token)

execTransactionFromModuleReturnData(addr.notice: Execute `operation` (0: Call, 1: DelegateCall) to `to` with `value` (Native Token) and return data

getModulesPaginated(address,uint256).notice: Returns an array of modules.         If all entries fit into a single page, the next pointer will be 0x1.         If another page is present, next will be the last element of the returned array.

isModuleEnabled(address).notice: Returns if an module is enabled

userdoc.notice: Modules are extensions with unlimited access to a Safe that can be added to a Safe by its owners. ⚠️ WARNING: Modules are a security risk since they can execute arbitrary transactions,  so only trusted and audited modules should be added to a Safe. A malicious module can completely takeover a Safe.

devdoc.author: Nick Dodson - <nick.dodson@consensys.net>Gonçalo Sá - <goncalo.sa@consensys.net>Stefan George - @Georgi87Richard Meissner - @rmeissner

multiSend(bytes).details: Sends multiple transactions and reverts all if one fails.

params.transactions: Encoded transactions. Each transaction is encoded as a packed bytes of                     operation as a uint8 with 0 for a call or 1 for a delegatecall (=> 1 byte),                     to as a address (=> 20 bytes),                     value as a uint256 (=> 32 bytes),                     data length as a uint256 (=> 32 bytes),                     data as bytes.                     see abi.encodePacked for more information on packed encoding

devdoc.title: Multi Send - Allows to batch multiple transactions into one.

multiSend(bytes).notice: This method is payable as delegatecalls keep the msg.value from the previous call         If the calling method (e.g. execTransaction) received ETH this would revert otherwise

devdoc.author: Stefan George - @Georgi87Richard Meissner - @rmeissner

multiSend(bytes).details: Sends multiple transactions and reverts all if one fails.

params.transactions: Encoded transactions. Each transaction is encoded as a packed bytes of                     operation has to be uint8(0) in this version (=> 1 byte),                     to as a address (=> 20 bytes),                     value as a uint256 (=> 32 bytes),                     data length as a uint256 (=> 32 bytes),                     data as bytes.                     see abi.encodePacked for more information on packed encoding

devdoc.title: Multi Send Call Only - Allows to batch multiple transactions into one, but only calls

multiSend(bytes).notice: The code is for most part the same as the normal MultiSend (to keep compatibility),         but reverts if a transaction tries to use a delegatecall.This method is payable as delegatecalls keep the msg.value from the previous call         If the calling method (e.g. execTransaction) received ETH this would revert otherwise

userdoc.notice: The guard logic is not required here as this contract doesn't support nested delegate calls

devdoc.title: OwnerManager - Manages Safe owners and a threshold to authorize transactions.

addOwnerWithThreshold(address,uint256).notice: Adds the owner `owner` to the Safe and updates the threshold to `_threshold`.

changeThreshold(uint256).notice: Changes the threshold of the Safe to `_threshold`.

getOwners().notice: Returns a list of Safe owners.

getThreshold().notice: Returns the number of required confirmations for a Safe transaction aka the threshold.

removeOwner(address,address,uint256).notice: Removes the owner `owner` from the Safe and updates the threshold to `_threshold`.

swapOwner(address,address,address).notice: Replaces the owner `oldOwner` in the Safe with `newOwner`.

devdoc.author: Stefan George - @Georgi87Richard Meissner - @rmeissner
devdoc.details: Most important concepts:      - Threshold: Number of required confirmations for a Safe transaction.      - Owners: List of addresses that control the Safe. They are the only ones that can add/remove owners, change the threshold and        approve transactions. Managed in `OwnerManager`.      - Transaction Hash: Hash of a transaction is calculated using the EIP-712 typed structured data hashing scheme.      - Nonce: Each transaction should have a different nonce to prevent replay attacks.      - Signature: A valid signature of an owner of the Safe for a transaction hash.      - Guard: Guard is a contract that can execute pre- and post- transaction checks. Managed in `GuardManager`.      - Modules: Modules are contracts that can be used to extend the write functionality of a Safe. Managed in `ModuleManager`.      - Fallback: Fallback handler is a contract that can provide additional read-only functional for Safe. Managed in `FallbackManager`.      Note: This version of the implementation contract doesn't emit events for the sake of gas efficiency and therefore requires a tracing node for indexing/      For the events-based implementation see `SafeL2.sol`.

addOwnerWithThreshold(address,uint256).details: This can only be done via a Safe transaction.

approveHash(bytes32).details: This can be used with a pre-approved hash transaction signature.      IMPORTANT: The approved hash stays approved forever. There's no revocation mechanism, so it behaves similarly to ECDSA signatures

params.hashToApprove: The hash to mark as approved for signatures that are verified by this contract.

changeThreshold(uint256).details: This can only be done via a Safe transaction.

checkNSignatures(bytes32,bytes,bytes,uin.details: Since the EIP-1271 does an external call, be mindful of reentrancy attacks.

params.data: That should be signed (this is passed to an external validator contract)
params.dataHash: Hash of the data (could be either a message hash or transaction hash)
params.signatures: Signature data that should be verified.                   Can be packed ECDSA signature ({bytes32 r}{bytes32 s}{uint8 v}), contract signature (EIP-1271) or approved hash.

params.baseGas: Gas costs for that are independent of the transaction execution(e.g. base transaction fee, signature check, payment of the refund)
params.gasPrice: Maximum gas price that should be used for this transaction.
params.gasToken: Token address (or 0 if ETH) that is used for the payment.
params.refundReceiver: Address of receiver of gas payment (or 0 if tx.origin).
params.safeTxGas: Gas that should be used for the safe transaction.

execTransaction(address,uint256,bytes,ui.details: The fees are always transferred, even if the user transaction fails.      This method doesn't perform any sanity check of the transaction, such as:      - if the contract at `to` address has code or not      - if the `gasToken` is a contract or not      It is the responsibility of the caller to perform such checks.

params.baseGas: Gas costs that are independent of the transaction execution(e.g. base transaction fee, signature check, payment of the refund)
params.gasPrice: Gas price that should be used for the payment calculation.
params.gasToken: Token address (or 0 if ETH) that is used for the payment.
params.refundReceiver: Address of receiver of gas payment (or 0 if tx.origin).
params.safeTxGas: Gas that should be used for the Safe transaction.
params.signatures: Signature data that should be verified.                   Can be packed ECDSA signature ({bytes32 r}{bytes32 s}{uint8 v}), contract signature (EIP-1271) or approved hash.

returns.success: Boolean flag indicating if the call succeeded.
Boolean flag indicating if the call succeeded.

setGuard(address).details: Set a guard that checks transactions before execution      This can only be done via a Safe transaction.      ⚠️ IMPORTANT: Since a guard has full power to block Safe transaction execution,        a broken guard can cause a denial of service for the Safe. Make sure to carefully        audit the guard code and design recovery mechanisms.

params.data: Data payload for optional delegate call.
params.fallbackHandler: Handler for fallback calls to this contract
params.paymentReceiver: Address that should receive the payment (or 0 if tx.origin)
params.paymentToken: Token that should be used for the payment (0 is ETH)
params.to: Contract address for optional delegate call.

simulateAndRevert(address,bytes).details: Performs a delegatecall on a targetContract in the context of self. Internally reverts execution to avoid side effects (making it static). This method reverts with data equal to `abi.encode(bool(success), bytes(response))`. Specifically, the `returndata` after a call to this method will be: `success:bool || response.length:uint256 || response:bytes`.

params.calldataPayload: Calldata that should be sent to the target contract (encoded method name and arguments).
params.targetContract: Address of the contract containing the code to execute.

swapOwner(address,address,address).details: This can only be done via a Safe transaction.

params.prevOwner: Owner that pointed to the owner to be replaced in the linked list

createChainSpecificProxyWithNonce(addres.details: Allows to create a new proxy contract that should exist only on 1 network (e.g. specific governance or admin accounts)      by including the chain id in the create2 salt. Such proxies cannot be created on other networks by replaying the transaction.

params._singleton: Address of singleton contract. Must be deployed at the time of execution.
params.initializer: Payload for a message call to be sent to a new proxy contract.
params.saltNonce: Nonce that will be used to generate the salt to calculate the address of the new proxy contract.

params._singleton: Address of singleton contract. Must be deployed at the time of execution.
params.callback: Callback that will be invoked after the new proxy contract has been successfully deployed and initialized.
params.initializer: Payload for a message call to be sent to a new proxy contract.
params.saltNonce: Nonce that will be used to generate the salt to calculate the address of the new proxy contract.

params._singleton: Address of singleton contract. Must be deployed at the time of execution.
params.initializer: Payload for a message call to be sent to a new proxy contract.
params.saltNonce: Nonce that will be used to generate the salt to calculate the address of the new proxy contract.

returns._0: The ID of the current chain as a uint256.

proxyCreationCode().details: Allows to retrieve the creation code used for the Proxy deployment. With this it is easily possible to calculate predicted address.

devdoc.title: Proxy Factory - Allows to create a new proxy contract and execute a message call to the new proxy within one transaction.

createChainSpecificProxyWithNonce(addres.notice: Deploys a new chain-specific proxy with `_singleton` singleton and `saltNonce` salt. Optionally executes an initializer call to a new proxy.

createProxyWithCallback(address,bytes,ui.notice: Deploy a new proxy with `_singleton` singleton and `saltNonce` salt.         Optionally executes an initializer call to a new proxy and calls a specified callback address `callback`.

createProxyWithNonce(address,bytes,uint2.notice: Deploys a new proxy with `_singleton` singleton and `saltNonce` salt. Optionally executes an initializer call to a new proxy.

getChainId().notice: Returns the ID of the chain the contract is currently deployed on.

devdoc.author: Richard Meissner - @rmeissner
devdoc.details: Should be always the first base contract of a library that is used with a Safe.
devdoc.title: SafeStorage - Storage layout of the Safe contracts to be used in libraries.

devdoc.title: SecuredTokenTransfer - Secure token transfer.

devdoc.author: Richard Meissner - @rmeissner
devdoc.title: SelfAuthorized - Authorizes current contract to perform actions to itself.

devdoc.author: Richard Meissner - @rmeissner

getMessageHash(bytes).details: Returns hash of a message that can be signed by owners.

signMessage(bytes).details: Can be verified using EIP-1271 validation method by passing the pre-image of the message hash and empty bytes as the signature.

params._data: Arbitrary length data that should be marked as signed on the behalf of address(this).

devdoc.title: SignMessageLib - Allows to sign messages on-chain by writing the signed message hashes on-chain.

devdoc.author: Richard Meissner - @rmeissner
devdoc.title: SignatureDecoder - Decodes signatures encoded as bytes

devdoc.author: Richard Meissner - @rmeissner

simulate(address,uint256,bytes,uint8).details: Executes the specified operation {Call, DelegateCall} and returns operation-specific data.      Has to be called via delegatecall.      This returns the data equal to `abi.encode(uint256(etimate), bool(success), bytes(returnData))`.      Specifically, the returndata will be:      `estimate:uint256 || success:bool || returnData.length:uint256 || returnData:bytes`.

devdoc.title: Simulate Transaction Accessor.

simulate(address,uint256,bytes,uint8).notice: Simulates a Safe transaction and returns the used gas, success boolean and the return data.

userdoc.notice: Can be used with StorageAccessible to simulate Safe transactions.

devdoc.author: Richard Meissner - @rmeissner
devdoc.title: Singleton - Base for singleton contracts (should always be the first super contract)        This contract is tightly coupled to our proxy contract (see `proxies/SafeProxy.sol`)

devdoc.author: Gnosis Developers

params.length: - the number of words (32 bytes) of data to read
params.offset: - the offset in the current contract's storage in words to start reading from

simulateAndRevert(address,bytes).details: Performs a delegatecall on a targetContract in the context of self. Internally reverts execution to avoid side effects (making it static). This method reverts with data equal to `abi.encode(bool(success), bytes(response))`. Specifically, the `returndata` after a call to this method will be: `success:bool || response.length:uint256 || response:bytes`.

params.calldataPayload: Calldata that should be sent to the target contract (encoded method name and arguments).
params.targetContract: Address of the contract containing the code to execute.

devdoc.title: StorageAccessible - A generic base contract that allows callers to access all internal storage.

getStorageAt(uint256,uint256).notice: Reads `length` bytes of storage in the currents contract

userdoc.notice: See https://github.com/gnosis/util-contracts/blob/bb5fe5fb5df6d8400998094fb1b32a178a47c3a1/contracts/StorageAccessible.sol         It removes a method from the original contract not needed for the Safe contracts.

devdoc.author: Richard Meissner - @rmeissner
devdoc.title: Default Callback Handler - Handles supported tokens' callbacks, allowing Safes receiving these tokens.

onERC1155BatchReceived(address,address,u.notice: Handles ERC1155 Token batch callback. return Standardized onERC1155BatchReceived return value.

onERC1155Received(address,address,uint25.notice: Handles ERC1155 Token callback. return Standardized onERC1155Received return value.

onERC721Received(address,address,uint256.notice: Handles ERC721 Token callback.  return Standardized onERC721Received return value.

supportsInterface(bytes4).notice: Implements ERC165 interface support for ERC1155TokenReceiver, ERC721TokenReceiver and IERC165.

tokensReceived(address,address,address,u.notice: Handles ERC777 Token callback. return nothing (not standardized)
